Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2010 09:29AM RunnerMom wrote: My onc and obgyn also recommended a low dose of Effexor, and it has worked very well for me.  It hasn't taken away the hot flashes completely, but has helped immensely.  Talk to your Dr!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Hotflashes alaskalady SusieMTN

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2011 06:30PM RunnerMom wrote: Three year survivor of IIIa here, too!  Hang in there, sister.  I'm running marathons and raising my family- hubs of 16 years, 16 yo son, 14 yo son, 7 yo daughter.  Breast cancer is quite the fight, but it is certainly do-able with love and support from those around you, and lots of prayers!  You've got my prayers for strength and peace. xoxo
Posts.Title: stage 3a breast cancer survivors mariar Icandoallthings

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2011 11:55AM RunnerMom wrote: I love happy news!!  Congratulations to you AND your family!!!  As a wife and momma with 3 "little" ones (16, 14, 8), and 3 years post dx, I cling to the positiveness and hope that this brings:)  Thanks for sharing!
